con:interface.name: Cards APIs
con:interface.con:description:
# Overview Cards APIs provide functionalities to retrieve and manage cards of a customer. For example, submit card application, retrieve card details, statements and application status.
# Version History Version | Release date | Link to documentation --------|--------------|---------------------- 1.0 | March, 2018 | Base version of API 1.0 | Aug, 2018 | Add sort parameter in Retrieve Card Summary
# Authentication Card APIs requires a valid **accessToken** to execute any operations. You can obtain one through the Authorization Steps. For more detailed instructions on requesting an *accessToken*, see **Getting Started** section for more details.
# Pagination Pagination is available on some API.
# Frequently Asked Question Q1: How to activate a card for overseas usage?
Ans: Activate overseas usage by using **/cards/{cardId}/overseasCardActivation** with path parameter cardId
Q2: What is the accessToken to be used in the API headers?
Ans: The accessToken should be the Partner's token and not the Customer's accessToken.
# Known Issues This API has no pending issues at the moment. Want to report a new issue? please help us **here**
# Throttling (Rate Limits) We throttle our APIs by default to ensure maximum performance for all developers.
Below is more details to control API rate limits

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: Submits Application for Principal/Supplementary Card Submit Card Application

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: Retrieves details of card application given an application identifier Retrieve Card Application Detail

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.name: blockCard
con:method.con:description: Block a Credit/Debit/Bank card. More than one cards can be blocked in a single request. Block card(s)

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.name: replaceCard
con:method.con:description: Replace or transfer a Credit/Debit/Bank card. Replace a card

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.name: unblockCard
con:method.con:description: Unblock a Credit/Debit/Bank card. More than one cards can be unblocked in a single request Unblock card(s)

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.name: retrieveCardDetails
con:method.con:description: Retrieve card details given a tokenized card identifier. Only Credit/Debit/Bank Cards are returned. Retrieve Card Details

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.name: retrieveCardStatementDates
con:method.con:description: Return list of statement dates for retrieval of past statements. Retrieve Card Statement Dates

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.name: cardActivationAdd
con:method.con:description: Activate a new Credit/Debit/Bank card. Activate a card

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.name: overseasCardActivation
con:method.con:description: Activate Credit/Debit/Bank card for overseas usage Activate a card for overseas usage.

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:parameter.con:name: permanentActivation
con:parameter.con:description: Indicates if overseas usage is to be activated permanently or temporarily. 'TRUE' -Permanent Activation, 'FALSE'- Non-Permanent Activation.

con:parameter.con:name: startDate
con:parameter.con:description: Activation start date. Format is YYYYMMDD.

con:parameter.con:name: endDate
con:parameter.con:description: Activation end date. Format is YYYYMMDD. This date is mandatory only for Non-Permanent Activation.

con:method.name: overseasCardDeactivation
con:method.con:description: Deactivate Credit/Debit/Bank card for overseas usage. Deactivate a card for overseas usage..

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.name: retrieveCardStatementSummary
con:method.con:description: Return card statement summary for a given card identifier and a statement date. Retrieve Card Statement Summary

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.name: retrieveUnbilledTransactions
con:method.con:description: Return unbilled transactions for given a card identifier. Retrieve unbilled transactions.

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.name: applyDebitCard
con:method.con:description: Register for new debit card application Create debit card application

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: Retrieves list of card applications belonging to a party Retrieve List of Card Applications

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: Return list of active Credit/Debit/Bank cards for a given party identifier. Retrieve Card Summary

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:parameter.con:name: sort
con:parameter.con:description: Specify the key for sorting in either ascending(asc) or descending(desc) order. Default is no sorting. Eg. sort=lastPurchaseDate:asc. Only 'lastPurchaseDate' is supported currently.

con:method.name: retrieveEligibleProducts
con:method.con:description: Retrieve the list of eligible card products for on-boarded customer. Retrieve eligible card products

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:parameter.con:name: applicationType
con:parameter.con:description:
Application Type
NEWCC=New credit card,
ADDNL=Additional credit card,
NEWEDC=New embossed debit card

con:parameter.con:name: partySegment
con:parameter.con:description:
Indicates party segment, mandatory if isStaff flag is false.
01=Treasures-Private Client,
02=Treasures,
03=Private Banking,
04=Personal Banking

con:interface.name: Mortgage Loan APIs
con:interface.con:description:
# Overview Mortgage Loan APIs provide functionalities to create and save, retrieve, update, cancel and search for a mortgage loan application, view list of loan pricing packages and to request for instant loan assessment. Current scope covers only retail applicant(s). # Version History Version | Release date | Change Log --------|--------------|---------------------- 1.0 | October, 2017 | Base version of API # Authentication <!-- ReDoc-Inject: <security-definitions> -->
# Pagination Pagination is not available on this API. # Frequently Asked Questions
Q1: How to get list of mortgage loan applications?
Ans: Get list of mortgage loan application for given application identifier using **/mortgages/{applicationId}/applicants** with path parameters applicationId.
Q2: How to get list of mortgage loan applications using search criteria?
Ans: Get list of mortgage loan application (s) for given application identifier using **/mortgages/search** using query parameters docType and docNumber.
Q3: How to get instant loan assessment?
Ans: Get instant loan assessment for any given application identifier using **/mortgages/{applicationId}/requestAssessment** with path parameters applicationId.
**Note:** A Mortgage loan application must be created prior to instant loan assessment.
# Known Issues This API has no pending issues at the moment. Want to report a new issue? please help us [here](mailto:developers@dbs.com)
# Throttling (Rate Limits) We throttle our APIs by default to ensure maximum performance for all developers.

con:method.name: calculateHDBAffordability
con:method.con:description: Calculate estimated maximum loan amount and maximum loan tenor for HDB flat. Calculate Loan Amount and Loan Tenor for HDB Flat

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.name: calculateHomeLoanAffordability
con:method.con:description: Calculate estimated maximum loan amount and maximum loan tenor for home loan. Calculate Loan Amount and Loan Tenor for Home Loan

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.name: initiateMortgageLoanUsingPOST
con:method.con:description: Initiate a new mortgage loan application using main applicant basic demographic and contact information, property type and loan pricing package. Initiate New Mortgage Loan Application

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: Return a list of mortgage pricing packages. If Tokenised Party ID is not provided, the MASS Market packets will be returned. Retrieve list of mortgage pricing packages

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:parameter.con:name: propertyType
con:parameter.con:description: Property Type. Example: Private Property (Landed), Private Property (Non-landed), HDB. Refer to Common Codes API for the list of values

con:parameter.con:name: loanType
con:parameter.con:description: Loan Type. Example: HousingLoan. Default value is 'HousingLoan'

con:method.name: searchApplicationsUsingGET
con:method.con:description: Return a list of mortgage application(s) matching the following search criteria. Document Type and Document Number Search for Mortgage Application(s)

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.name: retrieveApplicationStatusUsingGET
con:method.con:description: Return mortgage application details for a given application identifier Retrieve Mortgage Application Details

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.name: retrieveApplicantsUsingGET
con:method.con:description: Return a list of mortgage loan applicants for a given application identifier Retrieve List of Mortgage Loan Applicants

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.name: retrieveApplicantDetlUsingGET
con:method.con:description: Return mortgage loan applicant details for a given applicant identifier Retrieve Mortgage Loan Applicant Details

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.name: updateMortgageLoanApplicantUsingPOST
con:method.con:description: Update mortgage loan applicant details for a given applicant identifier. Update Mortgage Loan Applicant Details

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: Cancel an existing mortgage loan application Cancel mortgage loan application

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.name: retrieveApplicantCreditFacilitiesUsingGET
con:method.con:description: Return existing credit facilities and pending applications of all applicants for a given application identifier. It includes both Credit information from Credit Bureau (if available) and the information declared by the applicant(s). Retrieve Applicants' Credit Facilities

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:parameter.con:name: requestType
con:parameter.con:description: Request type, Indicate either credit information from Credit Bureau (CB) or credit facilities declared by applicant(s) is to be fetched. Possible values are 'CBInformation' or 'DeclaredCrFacilities'. Default is 'DeclaredCrFacilities'.

con:method.name: declareApplicantCreditFacilitiesUsingPOST
con:method.con:description: Declare credit facilities of all the applicants for a given application identifier. The credit facilities refer to all the existing facilities and pending applications that the applicant(s) have with the bank and other banks. Declare Applicant's Credit Facilities

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.name: updateLoansDetailsUsingPOST
con:method.con:description: Update loans details of a mortgage loan application. This API captures all the financing required by the applicant(s). Update Loans Details of Mortgage Loan Application

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.name: updatePropertyDetailsUsingPOST
con:method.con:description: Update property details of a mortgage loan application. This property refers to the property to be purchased. Update Property Details of Mortgage Loan Application

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: Return a list of mortgage loan applications for a given party identifier. Retrieve List of Mortgage Loan Applications

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:interface.name: Deposits API
con:interface.con:description:
# Overview The **Deposits API** allows you to perform account management operations such as account creation, account status updates and enquires on account information, account holders and transactions for various accounts held by the party.
The account types currently supported by the **Deposits API** are **Savings Account**, **Current Account**, **Fixed Deposits Account**, **Multi-Currency Account** and **Multiplier Account**.
The **Deposits API** also showcases all available HTTP request operations and their associated endpoints.
# Version History Version | Release date | Change Log --------|--------------|---------------------- 1.0 | October, 2017 | Base version of API
# Authentication <!-- ReDoc-Inject: <security-definitions> -->
# Pagination Pagination is available on the Deposit summary API.
# Frequently Asked Questions Q1: Can all the CASA accounts held by a party be viewed in one API call?
Ans: Yes, this information can be obtained using the Deposit summary API.
Q2: Can I get the account details of a Multi-Currency account?
Ans: Yes, the account details API provides information on the various currencies associated with MCA accounts.
# Known Issues This API has no pending issues at the moment. Want to report a new issue? please help us [here](mailto:developers@dbs.com)
# Throttling (Rate Limits) We throttle our APIs by default to ensure maximum performance for all developers.

con:method.name: createAccountUsingPOST
con:method.con:description: Creates an account. Current scope is for retail account only Create Account

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.con:description: Earmark an account on a specified amount of funds Earmark account on specific amount

con:parameter.con:name: accessToken
con:parameter.con:description: Access token generated through the Authorisation process

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.con:description: Search a given account number and if it is valid, return a tokenized account identifier Search a given account number

con:method.con:description: Return account details for a given account Retrieve Account Details

con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.con:description: Return list of placements for a given account. It includes both outstanding and matured placements. Retrieve List of Fixed Deposit placements

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.name: GET

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: Returns a summary of all the deposit products such as Savings, Current and MCA accounts for a given Party identifier. This does not include the Fixed deposit products. retrieve summary of Deposit Accounts

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:parameter.con:name: amount
con:parameter.con:description: Denotes the minimum balance amount required to filter the accounts in response

con:parameter.con:name: currency
con:parameter.con:description: Denotes the currency of accounts to be filtered in response. ISO 4217 3-character currency code
